item.title: In Suit For Declaration Of Title With Further Relief Of Possession, Limitation Period Of 12 Years... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Ruling Clarifies Limitation Period for Declaration of Title

Publication Date: 2024

Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court of India has clarified that there is no limitation period for suits requesting a declaration of title, as long as the right to the property continues. However, the limitation for possession claims is governed by the applicable Article of the Limitation Act.

  • The Court emphasized that a declaration of title does not expire as long as the right to the property exists.
  • When seeking possession alongside a declaration, the case is governed by Articles that pertain to possession.
  • The ruling reaffirmed the importance of proving adverse possession by the defendant for a limitation defense to hold.
  • The specific case involved an appeal against a Karnataka High Court decision allowing a plaintiff to amend a suit to include a claim for possession.
  • The Court ruled in favor of the plaintiff, reaffirming their right to seek possession based on title.
“A suit for a declaration of title to immovable property would not be barred so long as the right to such a property continues and subsists.” – Supreme Court

In conclusion, this ruling emphasizes that plaintiffs can seek relief based on established title without facing limitation issues unless defendants can prove adverse possession.

item.title: Senores Pharma IPO: GMP, subscription status to review. Apply or not as the issue gets fully booked on day one? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Senores Pharma IPO: GMP, Subscription Status and Investment Recommendations

Publication Date: 20th December 2024 | Source: Live Mint

This article discusses the IPO of Senores Pharma, which has fully subscribed on its first day and is generating positive interest in the grey market. Observers note a high Grey Market Premium (GMP), indicating potential investor returns.

Key Points

  • The IPO bidding began on 20th December 2024 and runs until 24th December 2024.
  • Senores Pharma's IPO was fully subscribed on day one with a bidding ratio of 1.78 times.
  • The grey market signals a premium of ₹191 today, suggesting a strong investor sentiment.
  • Market analysts recommend a 'subscribe' rating based on the company's fair valuation and growth potential.

Notable Quotes

“Senores Pharmaceuticals is a global research-driven pharmaceutical company. We recommend a SUBSCRIBE rating for the issue.” - Prathamesh Masdekar, Research Analyst at StoxBox.

Conclusion

The positive trends observed in the GMP and subscription status make the Senores Pharma IPO a compelling investment opportunity, according to various analysts and financial experts.

item.title: IPO GMP: What grey market signals about Mamata Machinery, DAM Capital, Transrail, Ventive Hospitality IPOs? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
IPO GMP: Grey Market Signals for Mamata Machinery, DAM Capital, Transrail, and Ventive Hospitality

Date: Unknown Source: Live Mint

The ongoing eight mainboard IPOs are showing robust investor interest, with shares trading at significant premiums in the grey market. Mamata Machinery leads with a premium of 107%.

  • Eight IPOs currently open for subscription.
  • Mamata Machinery's shares trading at a 107% premium.
  • DAM Capital Advisors and Transrail Lighting with premiums between 40-60%.
  • The grey market premium reflects investor sentiment ahead of stock listings.
“The last grey market premium (GMP) of the Mamata Machinery IPO shares was ₹260, with an estimated listing price of ₹503.”

These signals demonstrate strong optimism among investors for these upcoming listings, highlighting the importance of grey market premiums in assessing market sentiment.

item.title: Mamata Machinery IPO: GMP jumps after strong subscription status. Should you apply as the issue ends on Monday? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Mamata Machinery IPO: GMP jumps after strong subscription status

Date: December 23, 2024
Source: Live Mint

Bidding for the Mamata Machinery IPO ends today, with strong subscription numbers and positive grey market sentiments.

Key Points:

  • The IPO opened on December 19, 2024, and closes at 5:00 PM on December 23, 2024.
  • The IPO was subscribed 37.75 times, with the retail portion oversubscribed 51.03 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) stood at ₹261, signaling strong market interest.
  • Experts recommend subscribing to the IPO, citing Mamata Machinery's growth potential and unique market position.
"Mamata Machinery is strategically focused on strengthening relationships with existing customers and expanding its product offerings across geographies to drive growth." - Prathamesh Masdekar, Research Analyst

Investors are advised to make swift decisions as the IPO closes today, with expected allotment on December 24 and listing on December 27.

item.description:
Mutual Funds Sold Over 1 Crore Shares of These 7 Stocks in November

Date: Dec 21, 2024

Source: ETMarkets.com

In November, mutual funds sold significant volumes of shares across multiple stocks, indicating potential shifts in investment strategies.

  • Vodafone Idea: 16.39 crore shares sold, total shares reduced from 310 crore to 293 crore.
  • HDFC Bank: 6.09 crore shares sold, total shares reduced from 157 crore to 151 crore.
  • Power Grid Corporation of India: 4.80 crore shares sold.
  • National Aluminum: 2.66 crore shares sold.
  • Samvardhana Motherson International: 2.66 crore shares sold.
  • Ola Electric Mobility: 2.66 crore shares sold.
“Mutual funds sold a total of over 1 crore shares in November, reflecting changes in market conditions and fund strategies.”

This trend shows how market dynamics can influence mutual fund strategies, ultimately impacting stock prices.

item.title: Small-cap stocks under ₹100: Experts recommend six shares to buy next week | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Experts Recommend Six Small-Cap Stocks Under ₹100 for Next Week

Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: Live Mint

In light of the recent downturn in the Indian stock market, experts have recommended a list of small-cap stocks trading under ₹100 that investors should consider for potential gains in the coming week.

  • The Indian stock market has faced a notable decline with significant losses in key indices.
  • Nifty 50 index fell to 23,587, losing 1,181 points.
  • BSE Sensex recorded a drop of over 4,000 points, landing at 78,041.
  • Experts suggest a cautious approach and have identified six small-cap stocks worth investing in.
  • The recommended stocks include Shree Renuka Sugars, Fedders Holding, AMJ Land Holdings, VIP Clothing, Network 18, and Jain Irrigation Systems.

Notable Recommendations

  • 1] Shree Renuka Sugars: Buy at ₹38.70, target ₹43.80, stop loss ₹36.30.
  • 2] Fedders Holding: Buy at ₹76, target ₹80.50, stop loss ₹74.
  • 3] AMJ Land Holdings: Buy at ₹70.30, target ₹100, stop loss ₹60.
  • 4] VIP Clothing: Buy at ₹45.50, target ₹70, stop loss ₹40.
  • 5] Network 18: Buy at ₹73 to ₹74.50, target ₹75, ₹78, and ₹80, stop loss ₹71.80.
  • 6] Jain Irrigation Systems: Buy at ₹68 to ₹69.50, targets ₹72, ₹75, and ₹78, stop loss ₹66.

“Due to borrowed pessimism... however, on the daily chart, an advanced harmonic Bullish Cypher pattern was spotted.” - Aditya Gaggar, Director of Progressive Shares.

This cautious approach reflects the current volatility and uncertainty in the market, highlighting the importance of expert recommendations for investors.

item.title: These stock market stars are outpacing traditional stores in just ‘10-minutes’ | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
These stock market stars are outpacing traditional stores in just ‘10-minutes’

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

Food delivery apps in India are promising to bring biryani to hot beverages at customers’ doorsteps in under 10 minutes, as competition for impatient consumers intensifies among digital platforms.

  • Five companies, including Zomato and Swiggy, are launching quick food delivery services.
  • Zomato’s units rely on in-house kitchens while Swiggy partners with well-known restaurant chains.
  • India's online food delivery market is expected to exceed $15 billion by March 2029.
  • Quick commerce is making consumers more impulsive buyers according to market analysts.
  • Healthy food quality concerns arise as demand for speed increases in food delivery.
“Quick commerce has changed consumers who have become more impulsive buyers.” - Karan Taurani, Elara Securities

This rapid transformation highlights the changing dynamics of food delivery in urban India, where technology and consumer behavior converge to create a new economic landscape.

item.title: Siemens sounds alarm: Capital goods stocks plunge amid capex concerns - The Economic Times
item.description:
Siemens Signals Concerns: Capital Goods Stocks Decline Amidst Capex Worries

Publication Date: June 4, 2024 Source: Economic Times

Siemens experienced a significant 10% drop in its stock amid concerns about private capital expenditure growth in India, raising alarms in the capital goods sector. Analysts, however, remain optimistic regarding future developments.

  • Capital goods stocks fell, with Siemens noting minimal growth in private capital expenditure.
  • Shares of Siemens dropped to ₹6,869, marking its second-largest decline in a year.
  • The BSE Capital Goods index decreased by 3%, contrasting with its recent strong performance.
  • Positivity remains regarding government spending and a focus on sectors like decarbonization.
“The capital goods sector is expected to be a key focus in 2025, with earnings likely to improve starting Q4 FY25 with the outlook remaining positive.” - Pankaj Pandey, ICICI Direct

Overall, while current market sentiment has declined, the long-term outlook for capital goods in India remains promising, supported by government initiatives and sector-specific development.

item.title: Kia Syros To Be Crash Tested By Bharat NCAP Soon, Can It Get A Full 5 Star Rating? - CarDekho
item.description:
Kia Syros Set for Bharat NCAP Crash Test; Aiming for 5-Star Safety Rating

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros, Kia's latest mass-market SUV for India, is expected to undergo crash testing soon and is predicted to earn a 5-star rating due to its robust safety features.

  • The Syros slots between the Sonet and Seltos models.
  • Based on the reinforced K1 platform, shared with the Hyundai Grand i10 Nios.
  • Offers a safety suite with 6 airbags and electronic stability control from the base variant.
  • Higher variants include advanced features like ADAS and a 360-degree camera.
  • Launch expected in January 2025 with prices starting around Rs 9 lakh.
“With such a safety suite, chances are the Syros can earn a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP.”

The anticipation surrounding the Kia Syros reflects its strong emphasis on safety and features, potentially making it a standout offering in the Indian SUV market.

item.title: How Zomato, Swiggy, Zepto are achieving disruptive 10-min food deliveries - Hindustan Times
item.description:
How Zomato, Swiggy, Zepto are achieving disruptive 10-min food deliveries

Publication Date: December 20, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Food delivery apps in India are promising to deliver meals to customers’ doors in under 10 minutes, leading to intense competition among digital platforms.

  • Companies like Zomato and Swiggy are focusing on rapid food delivery to meet consumer demand.
  • Zomato's Blinkit and Zepto use in-house kitchens for speedy meal preparation.
  • Swiggy partners with established restaurants for quick delivery.
  • The rapid delivery trend has significantly impacted consumer behavior towards impulsive buying.
  • India's online food delivery market is expected to more than double by 2029, reaching $15 billion.
  • Concerns about food quality amidst fast preparation times remain a significant issue.
“Cook time 2 min, delivery time 8 min. We are suffering from the biggest epidemic of poor nutrition,” said Shantanu Deshpande.

The push for quicker deliveries indicates a transformation in the food delivery landscape in India, highlighting both opportunities for growth and challenges regarding food quality and health impacts.

item.title: BUY: ICICI Securities says THIS defence stock can give Rs 8500 profit in 2025 - Check company name - ET Now
item.description:
ICICI Securities Predicts PTC Industries Could See Rs 8500 Profit by 2025

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: ET NOW

ICICI Securities notes PTC Industries' completed acquisition of Trac Precision Solutions and predicts significant growth potential for the company's stock by 2025.

  • PTC Industries is acquiring Trac Precision Solutions to enhance its manufacturing capabilities in precision-engineered components.
  • The acquisition is expected to bridge a critical gap in India's engine manufacturing technology.
  • ICICI Securities has set a target price of Rs 20070 for PTC Industries shares, indicating a potential upside of over Rs 8500.
  • PTC Industries shares have experienced a notable increase, with 74% returns in 2024 and 99% over the past year.
  • The company has a market capitalisation of Rs 17,307.04 crore.
"PTC Industries shares have potential to cross Rs 20000-mark in 2025." - ICICI Securities

This forecast reflects strong confidence in PTC Industries' growth trajectory amidst the ongoing indigenisation efforts in India's defence sector.

Publication Date: Dec 21, 2024 - Source: Hindustan Times

item.title: Stock market crash: Sensex tanks over 4000 points this week. Can Nifty 50 save 23,250 support or more pain ahead? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock market crash: Sensex tanks over 4000 points this week. Can Nifty 50 save 23,250 support or more pain ahead?

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

In a dramatic downturn, the Indian stock market experienced significant losses, with the BSE Sensex falling over 4,000 points and the Nifty 50 index slipping to near critical support levels.

  • The Nifty 50 index dropped from 24,768 to 23,587, a loss of 1,181 points.
  • The BSE Sensex fell from 82,133 to 78,041, marking a significant decline.
  • Market experts attribute the crash to a hawkish US Fed outlook and heightened Foreign Institutional Investor (FII) selling.
  • Key support levels for Nifty 50 are at 23,800 and 23,250.
  • Analysts predict further volatility and a potential bearish trend if critical support levels are broken.
“The global cues turned weak after the hawkish guidance by the US Federal Reserve.” - Mahesh M Ojha, AVP — Research at Hensex Securities

The Indian stock market faces uncertain times as investors navigate the implications of international economic shifts and potential downward trends.

item.title: Qualcomm prevails on key issues in Arm suit | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Qualcomm prevails on key issues in Arm suit

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Mobile-phone chip giant Qualcomm largely prevailed Friday in a licensing dispute with chip design firm Arm Holdings.

A Delaware jury ruled that Qualcomm had a valid license to use Arm’s basic chip architecture for central processors it developed with the acquisition of a startup called Nuvia in 2021. The ruling paved the way for Qualcomm to continue selling those chips, which are at the heart of a range of devices including Microsoft Surface laptops.

  • Qualcomm won a significant jury ruling in their licensing dispute.
  • The jury confirmed Qualcomm's valid license with Arm Holdings.
  • This ruling allows Qualcomm to keep selling central processors stemming from their acquisition of Nuvia.
“The ruling paved the way for Qualcomm to continue selling those chips.”

This verdict is a crucial win for Qualcomm, ensuring their ongoing product offerings remain legally compliant and operational following the dispute.

item.title: Pegasus spyware maker NSO Group is liable for attacks on 1,400 WhatsApp users - The Verge
item.description:
NSO Group Responsible for Attacks on 1,400 WhatsApp Users

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: The Record

NSO Group, maker of the controversial Pegasus spyware, has been found liable for attacks on approximately 1,400 WhatsApp users following a lawsuit brought by Meta.

  • WhatsApp filed the lawsuit in 2019.
  • The judge ruled NSO Group violated multiple laws, including the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act.
  • A trial will proceed to determine the damages owed.
  • The ruling could set a precedent for accountability in the surveillance industry.
“This ruling is a huge win for privacy,” says Will Cathcart, head of WhatsApp. “Surveillance companies should be on notice that illegal spying will not be tolerated.”

The decision highlights the growing push for accountability among spyware manufacturers that infringe on user privacy.

item.title: ‘15-hour shift, verbal abuse’: Indian techie accuses startup founder of making him cry - Hindustan Times
item.description:
An Indian techie found support on Reddit when he claimed his boss made him cry during a video call. He accused his company's co-founder of being toxic.

Date: Dec 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

An Indian techie shared a post on Reddit accusing a company co-founder of verbally abusing him and other employees. In an emotional post, he described the individual as toxic and recounted a recent interaction where the founder’s behaviour reduced him to tears during a video call.

  • The techie works at a startup where the founder also acts as the tech lead.
  • He alleges working 15-hour shifts without clear directions and experiencing verbal abuse.
  • After an encounter during a meeting, he decided to take leave.
  • He received overwhelming support from social media users, offering advice and empathy.
“I could not hold my tears and started crying, and I was not in the mental zone to work, so I told him I am taking leave after a few hours of Google Meet,”

The incident has shed light on workplace toxicity and the emotional struggles faced by employees in the tech sector.

item.title: Qualcomm wins a legal battle over Arm chip licensing - The Verge
item.description:
Qualcomm Wins a Legal Battle Over Arm Chip Licensing

Publication Date: December 20, 2024

Source: The Verge

A federal jury has ruled that Qualcomm’s acquisition of Nuvia did not breach its licensing agreement with Arm, though the issue regarding Nuvia's compliance remains unresolved.

  • A jury in Delaware found no breach by Qualcomm in its agreement with Arm regarding the Nuvia acquisition.
  • The case has been ongoing for two years, arising from Arm's allegations of misuse of chip designs licensed to Nuvia.
  • The jury could not decide on Nuvia’s potential breach, allowing for future litigation.
  • Qualcomm acquired Nuvia for $1.4 billion to enhance its chip offerings.
  • Internal documents suggested Qualcomm may save $1.4 billion annually in Arm royalty payments.
“The jury has vindicated Qualcomm’s right to innovate...” - Ann Chaplin, Qualcomm’s General Counsel

This ruling marks a pivotal moment for Qualcomm, reaffirming its licensing strategies while leaving some legal questions open for further examination.

item.title: CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: Google layoffs saw 10% reduction in managers, directors, and vice preside - The Times of India
item.description:
CEO Sundar Pichai to Employees: Google Layoffs Saw 10% Reduction in Managers, Directors, and Vice Presidents

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a recent communication to employees, CEO Sundar Pichai disclosed that Google has experienced a 10% reduction in its management staff, including managers, directors, and vice presidents, as part of its ongoing organizational restructuring.

  • The layoffs are part of a larger effort to streamline operations within the company.
  • Key management roles were targeted to enhance efficiency and reduce expenses.
  • Pichai emphasized the company's commitment to innovation and productivity despite the cuts.
"We must remain agile and prioritize our resources effectively," said Pichai.

This strategic move reflects the tech industry's current trends towards restructuring and adapting to changing market conditions.
